Title: Excellent little camera.
Cons: Has some sophisticated features not well outlined in the manual.  Should have a dock included.  Screen not terribly huge or extremely high quality.  The digital zoom aspect is awful, images are horrible when it's employed.
Pros: It takes HD video, but don't forget you'll need Kodak's dock  (not a big deal, in fact a nice product).  The stills are excellent too, it's "brainless" mode picks the best setting for what it believes you're doing, and it does a fair job doing so.  It's price for a 12MP camera and HD video is pretty good.  The optical zoom is of great quality.
Comments: I'm sad because (according to review guidelines I cannot mention where) Newegg is cheaper than where I bought mine.  I should've got it here.

Title: Awesome Camera!
Cons: Video quality is good only when you have the right lighting. Considering it's a digital camera, this doesn't bother me that much.
Pros: HD quality pix with panning shots for wide screen shots in picture mode. Good price for the feature, so far the best out there.
Comments: Very good camera for it's price. Check out it's feature and compare it yourself.

Title: The camera
Cons: it's a little bigger then the new slim camera's, and so there is a limited amount of placed you can put it
Pros: I believe this camera is great, it has a decent amount of megapixles, the price was my reason for buying it in the first place, and for point and shoot photos, it's great, some someone with average knowledge of camera's this one works great.

Cons: Some of the other viewers mentioned that this camera displays an "impressionist" sort of painting of an object that isn't in the camera's focus, but that I think is to be expected in this price range.  I am going to upload some photos/video so everyone can see this for themselves.
Pros: I have had this camera for less than 2 hours, and think it is a very good choice for the casual photo taker.  I have recorded video, and taken photos, and the quality is awesome!  The picture and video quality on this camera are great.  This is a good quality camera for a basic/advanced user.
Comments: People who rate products low because they arrive dead are pretty stupid.  Just because UPS or Fedex threw your package around and broke your items does not mean the product deserves a low score...

Title: Kodak Z1285
Cons: None at this moment
Pros:
Takes nice clean shots and is easy to use.
Im satisfied with my purchase.
An excellent buy from Newegg, which included case,camera & 2 GB SD card. Cant beat the price.
Very satisfied.

Title: My first digital camera
Cons:
My pc doesn't like the software the camera came with nor does it like USB ports, but that's just my pc. It works fine on my fiance's pc...so it's not really a con. I just put all my photos on the memory card.

The only other con I have is when I turn the flash off and take a photo, most of the photos are blurry, as if destabilizes, but that could be 'cause I'm still learning about the camera.
Pros: I couldn't have picked a better choice for my first digital camera. I definitely got more for my money with this toy :) The selling point of this camera was 12MP and capability to record short video segments. 80 minutes (using an 8GB memory card)! The audio is awesome on it as well!
Comments: Buy rechargeable batteries! The batteries it comes with lasted barely a week. The rechargeable batteries I bought have lasted nearly three weeks and I've yet to charge 'em.

Title: Not a good choice
Cons: Where this camera really falters is lighting.  This camera seems to have bad optics or a subpar CCD, as light will be your enemy.  Anything with less than super-saturated lighting (outdoors) will cause your images to lose all fine detail.  All indoor pictures, even when well-lit and with the flash on at modest distance (6 feet) will cause you to get more of an impressionist painting than a picture.  The pictures will be made up of small splotches of color, annihilating detail areas and edges.  Because of this, pet fur, hair, and other fine details are captured more as smudges than what they really are.  I tried to live with it, but this pitfall is proving most depressing.  I will probably be returning this model for something else.  I don't know what yet.
Pros: This camera is inexpensive for a 12MP camera, and it will take some decent quality outdoor shots.
Comments: If all you want is a point and shoot for preserving some memories and aren't concerned with viewing your images at 12MP (100% zoom), this might actually be a decent choice.  If you are interested in a high quality image indoors, look elsewhere.  If all you are interested in is mid-day outdoors shooting, this will also be an ok choice.  Overall though, the six year old 3.2MP Fuji A303 this was meant to replace does about the same quality of job, except for outdoor shots.  Please note that I know I don't just have a fluke unit--if you check shots from this model other people have put on the net, the same problems do manifest themselves in their images.

Title: NIce Price
Cons: Hard to hold steady when shooting
Pros: Price IS great. Picture quality perfect, records great video, sounds ok on it to,
Comments: i would recomend getting a tipod for video

Title: you get what you pay for
Cons: This may be a 12 mp camera but it's pictures lack the sharpness of my 7mp canon.  Of course I paid $400 for the canon four years ago.  There is no way to adjust the compression or to take photos in RAW format so you're subject to what ever compression Kodak decided to use for the camera.
Pros: inexpensive 12MP camera with HD video and 5x zoom.  Surprisingly compact, the photos online don't do it justice.
Comments: The lay person would not know the difference or even care and would probably notice a positive difference if they were upgrading from another tier three digital camera MFG.  As for me, I will be returning it.

Title: Very good choice
Cons:
SOFTWARE!!!! IT IS AWFUL.... I had freezes during 50-60% of upload, lost few pictures during transfers(good thing they weren't important), too painful to use unless you print pictures at home I guess, but I prefer professional quality prints, so had to uninstall whole thing right away. Best choice is to get USB King$xxn SDHC card reader here on newegg which will make fast, seamless transfers and no lost pictures and you can use your favorite software to edit or print them.
Also it doesn't have case but with this price range I'm not surprised.
Pros: Small but not tiny size with good zoom, great resolution pictures, good image stabilization, good video (with 4GB SDHC Turbo takes half an hour of video of 1280x720 HD), powerful flash (took good picture in complete darkness from 10 feet away). with price range Vs. capabilities it makes it one of the best choices to buy.
Comments: Buy 4GB SDHC right away, I got 4GB and 8GB so now I'm set either for video or pictures, get high capacity rechargeable batteries, case, screen protector and you can become movie director:).
